meanings.definition: A person who shares in the patronage of something.
meanings.sent1: My friend is a copatron of our favorite restaurant, always joining me for meals there.
meanings.sent2: The copatron of the art gallery contributed to the funding of the new exhibit.
meanings.sent3: As a copatron of the local theater, I get to attend exclusive events and meet the actors.
meanings.sent4: Being a copatron of the charity feels like being part of a supportive community.
meanings.sent5: The copatron of the bookstore always recommends the best novels to read.

meanings.sent1: I copatroned the event to show my support for the cause.
meanings.sent2: She copatroned the charity auction, helping raise funds for a good cause.
meanings.sent3: We decided to copatron the local animal shelter's fundraiser together.
meanings.sent4: The group copatroned the museum renovation project, ensuring its success.
meanings.sent5: He copatroned the community garden project, bringing fresh produce to the neighborhood.
